pageContext.claim: “Germany is paying one percent of a much smaller GDP. We're paying close to four percent of a much larger GDP. Now, that doesn't work, folks. It doesn't work. So, I think we should pay the same as Germany, I just think we should pay the same as Germany.”
pageContext.analysis: The reason countries are supposed to spend a certain percentage of GDP is because some countries are much larger than others. The NATO guideline is 2 percent of GDP by 2024, so Germany (at 1.27 percent) is still behind that goal. But the U.S. percentage is much higher because it has global responsibilities, such as in the Pacific.
